Expert Comment: The Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra is the pinnacle of flagship experience, at least in the Android world. While not changing much in terms of design from last time around, the phone boasts of a massive 200MP primary camera on the back. There's also the specially customised Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 that sorts out your performance needs amicably. Samsung, being the king of displays, has provided a 6.8-inch Super AMOLED QHD+ panel that has a 120Hz refresh rate and a peak brightness of up to 1,750nits. Finally the device has an S-pen that slots right into the body and a 5,000mAh battery.

Expert Comment: The Realme GT 2 Pro is currently the company's best attempt at a flagship smartphone and it certainly makes heads turn. The  device packs in the latest Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 chipset while also getting a WQHD+ LTPO 2.0 AMOLED panel that refreshes at 120Hz. In terms of photography, you will not find a better combo at this price than the two 50MP shooters provided on the back. With its suave backpanel design, large 5,000mAh battery that supports 65W charging along with excellent stereo speakers, the GT 2 Pro is one of the best smartphones on the market.

Expert Comment: On paper, the iPhone 13 might not seem as equipped as some other competing devices on this list. That said, the smartphone is still backed by the fastest mobile processor from Apple in the form of A15 Bionic SoC. Lastly, the smartphone's cameras are a notch above what you'd get with the iPhone 12. In fact, the iPhone 13 clicks sharper images during the day and at night, the shots have lesser noise in them too. It also helps that the phone benefits from Apple's sensor shift technology and supports photographic styles and cinematic video mode too.

The device is powered by the new MediaTek Dimensity 8100 SoC that gives it parity to  current flagship smartphones from Qualcomm. The phone has the ability to charge at 150W which can top up the 5,000mAh battery less than 20 minutes. With subtle design choices and an excellent 120Hz AMOLED panel, the OnePlus 10R is one to look out for.

Expert Comment: The POCO F4 5G checks all the right boxes while being priced below the Rs 30,000 mark. With a 64MP primary camera that can snap impeccable photos and Qualcomm's Snapdragon 870 SoC at the helm to offer lightening fast processing speeds, the POCO F4 is truly a breakthrough device. The phone doesn't cut corners in the viewing department thanks to the 6.67-inch E4 AMOLED panel up front that can refresh at 120Hz. Combine that with a sturdy build quality, 80W fast charging and more, the POCO F4 is the smartphone to beat this year.

Expert Comment: OnePlus Nord 2, the latest addition to the brand's affordable Nord series, is a perfect fit between the premium mid-range phones and the affordable mid-range phones that offer good features. The phone basically tries to offer best of both worlds and in many departments, does it successfully. OnePlus Nord 2 is a perfect phone for you if you're looking at a phone that offers a clean UI, supports 5G connectivity, takes decent images, and offers good battery life. While the phone doesn't excel in one particular area, it tries to cover most aspects.
